com.dhemery.expressing

Class Evaluations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dhemery.expressing.Evaluations
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Expressive

    public class Evaluations
extends Object
    Builds fluent expressions to make assertions and evaluate boolean conditions. In contrast to the methods in other Expressiveâ€“related classes, these methods evaluate expressions immediately, without polling. These methods are all declared static, so they can be used without instantiating an Expressive.

              boolean value)
        Assert that the boolean value is true.

        AssertionError - if the boolean value is false

      • assertThat

        public static <T> void assertThat(T value,
                  org.hamcrest.Matcher<? super T> criteria)
        Assert that the value satisfies the criteria. Delegates to MatcherAssert.assertThat(Object, org.hamcrest.Matcher).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to evaluate
        criteria - the criteria the value is to satisfy
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the value does not satisfy the criteria

      • is

        public static <S> org.hamcrest.Matcher<S> is(S value)
        Create an implicit "equalTo" matcher, decorated to make it more expressive. Delegates to Matchers.is(Object).

      • is

        Decorate a matcher to make it more expressive. Delegates to Matchers.is(org.hamcrest.Matcher).
